message: Do not use apt as it is meant to be a end-user tool, use apt-get or apt-cache instead
Multiple consecutive `RUN` instructions. Consider consolidation.
Do not use apt as it is meant to be a end-user tool, use apt-get or apt-cache instead

Set the SHELL option -o pipefail before RUN with a pipe in it. If you are using /bin/sh in an alpine image or if your shell is symlinked to busybox then consider explicitly setting your SHELL to /bin/ash, or disable this check

Pin versions in apt get install. Instead of `apt-get install <package>` use `apt-get install <package>=<version>`

Avoid use of wget without progress bar. Use `wget --progress=dot:giga <url>`.Or consider using `-q` or `-nv` (shorthands for `--quiet` or `--no-verbose`).
